thread.title: Vintage Classics: Prize Draw Terms and Conditions
thread.title_full: Vintage Classics: Prize Draw Terms and Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Vintage Classics: Prize Draw Terms and Conditions
text: Vintage Classics: Prize Draw Terms and Conditions 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over. Employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited (“Promoter”), Studiocanal Limited and Classic British Hotels, their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw are not eligible to enter. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via telegraph.co.uk/vintageclassics and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to Vintage Classics Prize Draw Winner, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday, November 1, 2015. 6. The Promoter will contact the winner by telephone or email within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value shall be provided. 8. One winning entrant will win a short break for two in the Cotswold Lodge Hotel, Oxford. The prize includes accommodation in a twin or double room on a bed and breakfast basis and two adult tickets to Blenheim Palace Park and Gardens. 9. The prize must be taken as one package. 10. The prize does not include travel, travel insurance, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs, other than where mentioned. 11. The prize must be booked and taken before March 31, 2015 and excludes the Christmas and New Year’s period, Valentine’s Day, Easter, bank holidays and dates on which events at the hotel are taking place. Availability may be restricted during peak times such as Friday and Saturday nights. Once confirmed, the booking cannot be amended. The winner and their guest must take the prize together. 12. The prize is subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 13. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and Studiocanal Limited. 14. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw, including provision of the prize, and in accordance with the permissions entrants grant or withhold at the point of entry. 15. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and/or Studiocanal Limited. Accordingly the Promoter and/or Studiocanal Limited may at its absolute discretion vary, amend or cancel the promotion without notice and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter and/or Studiocanal Limited as a result thereof. Any changes to the promotion will be notified to entrants by the Promoter as soon as possible. 16. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of Studiocanal Limited. 17. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
